titleStmt.title: The present interest of England, or, A confutation of the Whiggish conspiratours anti-monyan principle shewing from reason and experience the ways to make the government safe, the king great, the people happy, money plentifull, and trade flourish.
titleStmt.author: Nalson, John, 1638?-1686.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Duke University Library.
Attributed to John Nalson. cf. BM.
